grails.plugins.directoryservice
[Groovy] Class DirectoryServiceEntry

java.lang.Object
  grails.plugins.directoryservice.DirectoryServiceEntry

class DirectoryServiceEntry

When DirectoryService returns a result set, it wraps each result object in a DirectoryServiceEntry object. This class allows you to interact with an UnboundID SearchResultEntry as if it were a writable Entry. In fact, when it is constructed with a SearchResultEntry, it duplicates the entry which results in an UnboundID Entry object, which you can update. The updating is done by overriding propertyMissing(String name, value).

Authors:
Lucas Rockwell

Field Detail

modifications

private java.util.ArrayList modifications
Holds the actual directory modifications. Gets reset by discard() and cleanupAfterSave().

mods

private java.util.Map mods
Simple map for keeping track of whether or not an attribute has changed. We keep this up-to-date as well as modifications because it is a lot easier to inspect this for changes when calling isDirty(attribute) than looping through the modifications array. Gets reset by discard() and cleanupAfterSave().

 
Property Detail

baseDN

java.lang.String baseDN
The base DN which was used for searching for this entry. It is important that we have this because we need it when we save or delete the entry, i.e., it is critical that we map this entry to its source.

entry

com.unboundid.ldap.sdk.Entry entry
UnboundID Entry object. Gets reset to searchResultEntry.duplicate() by discard().

errors

java.lang.Object errors
Simple map for keeping track of any errors which might occur when using the object. For now, if directoryService.save(this) throws an error, it will populate errors['save'] with the reason. Gets reset by discard() and cleanupAfterSave(). Note: A future version of this class will have an errors object that implements the Spring Errors interface, so the error handling will change.

searchResultEntry

com.unboundid.ldap.sdk.SearchResultEntry searchResultEntry
The original searchResultEntry. Gets reset to a copy of entry on cleanupAfterSave()

 
Constructor Detail

DirectoryServiceEntry

DirectoryServiceEntry(com.unboundid.ldap.sdk.SearchResultEntry searchResultEntry, java.lang.String baseDN)
Constructs a new DirectoryServiceEntry object by passing in an UnboundID SearchResultEntry. It then takes the SearchResultEntry and calls duplicate() on it so that we end up with an Entry object which and then be modified.
Parameters:
searchResultEntry - The search result entry that will be used in this object.
baseDN - The baseDN which was used to get the connection to the appropriate directory.

 
Method Detail

cleanupAfterSave

java.lang.Object cleanupAfterSave()
Similar to discard(), but instead of resetting the entry, it recreates the searchResultEntry from the entry object, as we want the state of this object to be what was just saved to the directory.

discard

java.lang.Object discard()
Discards any changes made to the object. Reinitializes both the mods map and the modifications array, and sets the entry as a duplicate of the searchResultEntry.

isDirty

java.lang.Object isDirty(java.lang.Object attribute = null)
Checks to see if this object has been modified. You can also pass in an optional attribute name to check to see if just that one attribute has been modified. Note: This method is named isDirty to match GORM.
Parameters:
attribute - Optional attribute name to check to see if it has been modified.
Returns:
true if this object (or the supplied attribute) has been modified, and false otherwise.

methodMissing

java.lang.Object methodMissing(java.lang.String name, java.lang.Object args)
Intercepts the following methods:
  • getAttributeValues()
  • <attribute name>Values()
  • <attribute name>AsDate()
  • <attribute name>AsBoolean()
  • <attribute name>AsLong()
  • dn()
These need to be called as methods instead of properties because with LDAP you never know if someone is going to name their attribute with one of these names at the end, so it is safest to force them to be methods.

propertyMissing

java.lang.Object propertyMissing(java.lang.String name)
Any property which is called on this class is passed as a getAttributeValue() method call to the entry object which is set on this class. If the entry object is not set, the method throws a MissingPropertyException. This method detects if the attribute name is 'dn', and if it is, it calls entry.getDN() instead of entry.getAttributeValue().

propertyMissing

java.lang.Object propertyMissing(java.lang.String name, java.lang.Object value)
This propertyMissing gets invoked when a value is supplied with the property name, so we override it so that we can set values in the entry object. We also set the mods map, and update the modifications ArrayList.

updateModifications

java.lang.Object updateModifications(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String... values)
Updates the modifications ArrayList with the UnboundID Modification that will be used when the entry is updated in the directory. This is called by the propertyMissing(String name, value) method, so there is no need to call it directly. However, if you want to short-circuit propertyMissing and update a bunch of attributes and then immediately save, you can use this method directly. But understand that the mods map will not be updated, and isDirty() will no know that you have modified the object.
Parameters:
name - The name of the attribute for the modification.
values - One or more String values to apply to the supplied attribute name.
See Also:
propertyMissing(String name, value)
